text: thumb|right|Biala Podlaska Voivodeship Biała Podlaska Voivodeship () was a unit of administrative division and local government in Poland in the years 1975-1998, superseded by Lublin Voivodeship. Its capital city was Biała Podlaska. This voivodeship had the highest percentage of ethnic Belarusians in Poland. ==Major cities and towns== * Biała Podlaska (56,300 inhabitants in 1995) * Łosice * Międzyrzec Podlaski * Parczew * Radzyń Podlaski * Terespol ==See also== * Voivodeships of Poland Category:Former voivodeships of Poland (1975–1998) Category:1975 establishments in Poland Category:History of Lublin Voivodeship
title: Biała Podlaska Voivodeship
